snippet: The State Supreme Court ruled that it did not have the authority to void some of the pardons issued by Gov. Haley Barbour in his final days in office.
abstract: Mississippi Supreme Court rules that the judicial branch does not have authority to void the nearly 200 pardons granted by outgoing Gov Haley Barbour, bringing a definitive end to a long legal controversy; decision centers on the fact that overturning the pardons would violate constitutional separation of powers.
lead_paragraph: The State Supreme Court ruled that it did not have the authority to void some of the pardons issued by Gov. Haley Barbour in his final days in office.

headline.seo: Miss. Supreme Court Upholds 9 Pardons by Barbour
headline.main: Highest Court in Mississippi Upholds 9 Pardons
headline.print_headline: Highest Court In Mississippi Upholds 9 Pardons
